Reviews.Title: With the CORRECT Battery, a Fantastic Little Camera...
Reviews.Author: Mercedes L. Johnmeyer
Reviews.Content: I've been using the Kodak Z712 for the past couple years and LOVE it. However for vacations, it was a bit bulkier then I liked. I didn't want to downsize from a 12X zoom to a 3X, so I just continued using it till something else caught my attention. Enter the Z1485. An AWESOME little camera.I received the camera in mid-December. I used the battery that came with it, a non-rechargeable KLIC-8000 Li-Ion. It lasted about a month, all through Christmas (during which I took MANY pictures) and regular daily pics (I have an 11 month old, so I take a lot!). I just changed the battery a few days ago to a rechargeable KLIC-8000 Li-Ion. If you purchase this camera, MAKE SURE you buy the correct battery for it. Of course it's going to suck up regular AA batteries, it's a powerful little point and shoot.The picture clarity is fantastic (keep in mind, I'm just a casual picture taker. Day-to-day pics of my son, and family trips). All the pics I've downloaded to my Kodak program and printed out have come out beautifully. I normally use the smart-scene, but sometimes (like during Christmas) I use other settings, like the candle light setting for pics of the Christmas tree. They came out perfect, all nice and soft. The size of the camera itself is perfect...I actually bought an ipod jogging case for it so I can wear it around my wrist or arm during vacations (nice to always have the camera handy), and it fit just fine.I've always used Kodak for their simple no-brainer approach to picture taking, and this camera fits that to a tee. I'm so glad I upgraded. I'll always love my Z712, but this little guy has everything I need. PLEASE do not be dissuaded by the mediocre reviews here. Most people know NOT to put regular AA batteries in a digital camera. It sucks the life out of them in no time. With the proper batteries, this camera is light, clear, and does an all around GREAT job!

Reviews.Title: OK camera, not what I was hoping for.
Reviews.Author: starsirius "starsirius"
Reviews.Content: I found this camera for a price that made it worthwhile to try. And I tried it. I wouldn't say it was disappointing, but definitely not what I wanted. I am very much a point & shoot type of photographer--as you'll see in my limited lingo below.My findings:Pros:Smart capture is a nice feature that automatically determines the best settings for whatever you're trying to take a picture of. (Great for point & shoot types).Button placement is pretty intuitive.Cons:There is no viewfinder. This is of course a preference thing, but I found it hard for taking pictures in direct sunlight and in night shots (high amount of pixelation and streaking on screen).The USB cord was very flimsy and easily damaged.In many reviews I've read, there are a lot of complaints about the battery life. My only issue about the batteries is that after about 40 shots, the start-up and lag time between shots increased significantly--many missed opportunities.Most of my night shots came out blurry, even though the camera was on a steady surface. Close-up night shots came out highly pixelated.Face capture never worked (although this might be user error).

Reviews.Title: Exceptional Clarity
Reviews.Author: K. Kersten
Reviews.Content: Having been an adrenalin filled amateur photographer I have used Kodak camera C330, C813 and Z1275 for the last several years taking pictures deep within caves; while rock climbing or white-water rafting. I am really impressed by the pictures that the Kodak Z1485IS is producing. The pictures are stunning; sharp, and contain an amazing amount of detail.  The first day I took a sample pictures of flowers and found an insect on them; it looked like a nature magazine picture!  Every picture seems to look fantastic when  I use the auto select snap and shoot mode.The HD video is fantastic; although many computers have a hard time playing it because of the huge file size. This video is not shaky like the first generation Kodak Z1275 which was just not ready for prime time. You can even zoom in while shooting video.Getting this camera and seeing the great photos may make you feel like a professional. Buttons and settings are very natural and easy to use for a point and shoot. You will be tempted to shoot a lot of pictures and video. Unfortunately; do to the huge file size of video do not expect to be able to share it. A 64 second 720 HD video of horses was 107 megabytes. Sharing large picture files (14mp=2-8megs) can be difficult too. I upgraded my subscription smugmug photosharing site to be able to share the HD video.Sample pics... [...]Running on Lithium AA batteries was essential for me as I frequently am in extreme environments -like caves- where I cannot put the camera on a charger. If you use alkaline batteries in a pinch only expect 30 minutes of operation. Energizer Ultimate Lithium gives about 2-4 hours on a $5 a set.I am preparing to depart on an overseas trip and am really excited to be taking the Kodak 1485IS camera with me. It is easy to use; takes great pictures and mind blowing video. I think Kodak nailed the right combination of features with this one.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I expected from my Kodak
Reviews.Author: kdea473
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a Kodak 6 MP camera that bit the dust on a recent vacation (user error, no fault of the camera!).  I spent several weeks researching cameras, going to every store to hold them in my hands, and ended up buying this gem from Amazon.I have been very pleased with the picture quality both indoors and out.  I am especially impressed with the photo quality in low light (considerably less noise than I have ever experienced in a digital camera).  The focus is great, and moves right along with my subjects.The video is nice, though definitely not why I bought the camera.  It is very smooth and works well even in low light.  I have had no problems with the battery holding a charge.My biggest complaint (which I knew when I was buying the camera) is the lack of optical viewfinder.  It was nearly impossible for me to find a camera with one, and I would have had to give up other features to get it.All in all, I am very pleased with this Kodak camera.  It is my third Kodak digital camera (a 4 MP, a 6 MP, and now this one) and definitely the best.  The price was also fabulous, especially compared with what features rival camera manufacturers offer at this price point.

Reviews.Title: Most bang for your buck.
Reviews.Author: Kenneth M. Fagan "[Hou*]Ammanon"
Reviews.Content: I was a little weary at first about buying a camera that claims 14.2 megapixels for this price.  But let me tell you, this is an amazing little camera that takes phenomenol pictures and video.  Recently my house took on about 4 inches of water due to a freak storm.  I was able to take a picture through a whole in the ceiling of a 1/2" water pipe that was leaking.  The picture came out flawless.  No ordinary camera could do that.  This camera has a multitude of features for any lighting conditions. With my misfortune at the house I have used pretty much every one of them.  The panoramic feature is very cool also.  I do believe that is my favorite setting.  At the Kemah waterfront (Kemah Texas), all my photos came out very sharp. The color was amazing and crisp.  I will warn against what type of memory chip you purchase for this camera.  I wanted to stay with Kodak but they did not seem to offer what I wanted.  I ultimatley went with a Sandisk product. 16 gig HD Video.  I can put almost 4000 14.2 megapixel pictures on it.  I can also take 2 hours of 760p video.  This memory card was a good price for what you get.  All in all, Amazon gets 5 stars, Beach Camera gets 5 stars, and Sandisk gets 5 stars. I am very pleased with my purchase and would not change anything.side note, the Sandisk card will hold over 9000 pictures set at 5 megapixels.  Not bad.

Reviews.Title: Versatile handy and all around nice digicam
Reviews.Content: We've wanted a new digital camera for several years. I read & read - much of it here on Amazon. I'm shy of professional reviews (which can be overly into high end stuff) I like the reviews here on Amazon alot.One of the biggest gripes I've seen here have been related to power issues. Yes You Must use Lithium Batteries or you're gonna be Disappointed. Its Twenty-0-9  get yer darn lithiums and move forward. Amazon has great deals on the lithium batteries - they're the Kodak KLIC-8000 style but the generic ones work quite well.One of the things about it nearly being 2010 is small is the way things are. I like the fact that I can easily carry my Z1485 in my pocket. Thing is, I hate the way most of these cameras give you nothing to hold onto. Grabbing cameras at local retailers I found most of them all too easy to drop. That was the first thing I liked about the Z1485. That bit of a bulge with that rubbery strip makes it far easier to hold than most cameras in this class. The on screen little let you know what mode you just went into is handy too. A true view finder sure would be preferable but the screen works okay.Then I seemed to recall that Kodak had slipped in to an abyss of poor quality and lack of keeping up with current technology. I went back and started doing some research and found that they had done a come back and were back as being a maker of `good bang for the buck' cameras.I found that it had both the point & shoot for my hunny and multiple program modes for myself. We do alot of photography at night club shows - difficult and generally dim lighting, performers moving, dancing, and so on. The relatively large CCD helps the Z1485 handle poor lighting.  Ricky likes the 'smart capture' features and gets plenty of good shots. The optical image stabilization is awesome!The first pics I took with it were done by setting it to smart capture in a dim bar with awful lighting. I shook the camera like a can of spray paint and hit the shutter button repeatedly trying to get blur, backlighting, and whatever other intentionally bad situations to see what I'd get for results. What I got was a bunch of pretty good pictures of things I didn't care about. I was amazed at how well the Z1485 did with me trying to get bad pix. Of course when trying for good pix they're oft pretty good. Using the program modes is even better (for those of us so inclined)We give it two thumbs up. heres a little thing on the smart capture feature -  [...]

Reviews.Title: this camera is amazing
Reviews.Author: C. Bican
Reviews.Content: I actually bought my first kodak 14 mega pixel at hsn but it must have gotten hit against something hard and the screen became broken,however i loved that camera and since i had all the extras i decided to buy it from amazon. Excellent service by the way, the pictures from this camera are "THE MOST" beautiful they are clear and gorgeous. My daughter just had her prom and wanted pictures by a pond in the park and since it was soo sunny i used the option for by the beach and light behind the subject they are the most beautiful pics everyone that saw them on my daughters facebook page commented on how good they turned out. Now i just need to find a printer to print them out as wonderful as they look on my computer!

Reviews.Title: You've gotta try this one.
Reviews.Author: R. Diaz
Reviews.Content: I really wanted a good digital camera so I started looking for reviews online. That's when I discovered this 14mp camera and I suddenly NEEDED it so bad. I've never seen a 14MP camera, especially for under $200!. Still, I thought really hard before buying this camera. Even though it has some great reviews there were some people that insisted it took horrible pictures. SERIOUSLY?! I couldnt take a horrible picture with this camera if I tried! I bought it on ebay last week for [...] bucks (I KNOW!! :) ).So far i've taken really great pictures with it. Im still trying out all the settings because there are so many and I want to experiment which ones work best with certain lighting. Im so glad I didnt listen to the bad reviews. I'm not sure if people realize that you have to hold down the shutter button half way and the camera will let you know when to take the picture (the frame will turn green). This takes less than a second but the results are great. Before you post a review saying youre getting blurry or bad pictures, make sure you are using the right setting.

Reviews.Title: Great digi cam, but Li Ion batteries are a MUST!
Reviews.Author: 2thMan
Reviews.Content: So far, excellent digital camera! Only "cons" discovered were that any power source other than rechargable Lithium Ion batteries are impractical.  This little powerhouse of a camera gobbles up other batteries like a wood chipper!  Also, I've found that you must be in the auto mode to get to macro program.  You cannot select Macro from the dial.  I did experience difficulty trying to take a macro photo where the camera oscilated between auto and macro.  Many macro shots  were out of focus because of this.  This was a minor issue, though.  Overall, very, very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Another great Kodak camera
Reviews.Author: Joizee Doc "Yo"
Reviews.Content: This is another great camera from Kodak.  I had some reservations about this purchase based on other's concerns about battery life. Simply put- if you use Lithium batteries, there is no problem.  I have taken over 1000 photos and movies with 2 battery changes.  The picture quality and ease of use is great.  I appreciate the manual mode even though I do not get much use out of it yet.My only complaint is that the camera can sometimes take too long to process a command (delete, review), but this is a great little point and shoot.I am very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Could Have Been Better
Reviews.Author: Silver Dragon
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after my point-and-shoot died.Here are my problems with it:1) It does not come with a charger. They expect you to charge it off your computer or buy the charger separately. I find that this is a rather cheap way to make you buy another one of their products: everyone knows that a computer is not necessarily always available.2) The photographs that it produced were grainy when blown up, which is not particularly favorable when you're trying to crop images for websites or posters.3) The time it took to refresh after taking a photo was kind of long.4) It fell flat on the floor in action shots.Overall, this would be a good spare camera, but I wouldn't recommend it as a main camera unless all you want to do is take photos of your kid's birthday party.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the casual photog
Reviews.Author: Vincent Abrams
Reviews.Content: I took it down to Florida for a few days and took some really great pics with it.  They were all clear no matter what conditions under which they were taken.  My girlfriend had more fun with it than I did, taking all sorts of different photos and some video, for which you do need a memory card. I was able to get an 8MG card for $14 from Amazon.  I like the color and the compactness of it.  My only concern is that it's not the thinnest camera you can buy. It's almost 1.5 inches at it's thickest.  I got a case for it, again from Amazon, and it fits perfectly, and I have room for an extra card and batteries. Speaking of which, it would have been nice if it had come with a charger, since it's got rechargeable batteries.  My mom has an 8MP Kodak and I can tell the difference in the photos, though hers is thinner.  If you don't mind the relative bulk, it's a great little camera with lots of features.

Reviews.Title: SLR user love this camera
Reviews.Author: Dianna L. Hall "bugwatcher"
Reviews.Content: IM A SLR USER, I LOVE THIS KODAK.  I BOUGHT IT FOR THE TIMES I DON'T WANT TO PACK AROUND A HEAVY CAMERA.  THIS KODAK'S FUNCTIONS ARE SUPER EASY TO NAVIGATE THROUGH, BLACK & WHITE, ISO, SPEED, ETC.  THE EASE OF THE CAMERA AUTO FOCUS IS GREAT TOO.  THE BEST FEATURE IS THE EXCELLENT VIDEO QUALITY, IT IS ALSO FAIRLY EASY TO SELECT FRAMES FROM THE VIDEO TO MAKE A PHOTO FROM.  I LIKE THE RAISED PORTION ON THE CAMERA, IT FEELS BETTER THAN A FLAT CREDIT CARD SIZE, IT ALSO FITS IN MY SMALL PURSE.  IT IS PERFECT FOR KIDS.  AND OF COURSE, IT DOES TAKE NICE PHOTOS.  THE PANORMANIC PHOTOS ARE FUN TO MAKE.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: R. Fahringer "Bobbysgirl"
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome!  Picture quality is beautiful.  The video quality is also very good. It's easy to use, light and very portable.  It doesn't fit in your pocket but it's light and easy to carry in a small camera case.  The original battery lasted for several hundred pix.  I had purchases a rechargable one because of the comments that I had read before I purchased.  I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the right price!!
Reviews.Author: Tracy M. Taylor
Reviews.Content: I love my kodak!! I was looking for a rechargable camera but settled for this one because of the price. The pictures are clear as day and the close-ups are incredible! It takes lithium batteries though, and have found the batteries last longer if you take them out or insert a little piece of paper to block the batterie's connection to the metal plate. It seems the power "leaks" from the batteries even if it is off which is a small inconvenience for the quailty of photos that it provides. GREAT PRODUCT!!

Reviews.Title: Best deal in the Amazon camera house!
Reviews.Author: Richard Burton "Media therapist"
Reviews.Content: This camera is an amazing deal for 14 megapixels and HD video! I put it in my back pocket most days and get some great shots with ease.  If you would like to make a great little view finder for it, I suggest purchasing a nine dollar accessory that makes it easy to use it in bright sunlight (Any camera  LCD screen is a problem in bright light without a hood)  Get a Pana-Vue 3 Slide Viewer and just remove the frosted plastic, then put it over the screen - For one more step up add a nine dollar Kalt eyecup NPECCA for Canon by stretching over the magnifier end and Voila, for eighteen bucks you've got a viewfinder that allows you to press your eye up to the camera and also helps stabilize for better shots/composition.  Now you can set the viewscreen to powersaver mode and get better battery life too.  This little unobtrusive gem of a camera fits into a back pocket, takes excellent pics, does panorama stitch in a few seconds like magic, HD video, easy to use, can be adjusted manually if you like.  Order an aftermarket klic 8000 equivalent automatic charger and two or three aftermarket lithium batteries - and read the directions for charging carefully - you will have all you need for many hours of daily shooting and wonderful fun memories.  But you still have to do SOME work to compose your shots and not hold your Z1485 like Beavis and Butthead loaded up on chocolate donuts and Red Bull!  Today's Mindfulness Tip: Cameras will only work for you if you focus yourself first.  The other cameras in this technology class that I looked at were easily 3x as much money and had poor ergonomics. So Enjoy and spend the money you saved for a trip to a beautiful place for more memories.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Z1485 IS is a great little camera
Reviews.Author: J. Reichard "ASE cert. mechanic"

I figured this would give the would-be buyer a good idea of what the quality was like. Takes HD video which is awesome. And the 14 megapixel pictures look great. The videos are taken in quicktime, which kinda sucks, so I purchase a movie converter, and convert them to Windows Movie format, and now all is good.Would recommend this to anyone...great camera, great video.

Reviews.Title: Good camera-bad battery options
Reviews.Author: hoot "Jim"
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the performance of the camera.  The optics, functions, and controls were very good, but for a camera of this price you would think that Kodak would include a rechargable battery system as a standard part of the package. In order to have a decent rechargable battery which supplies a decent number of pictures per charge, you must pay at least another $30 and order a charger and a Kodak rechargable lithium ion battery.  By that time I would have paid $205 so I returned the camera and bought a nice Cannon 1200 IS. There are many good quality cameras in the same class which come standard with all of this included and will not cost over $170 delivered.  Kodak is too interested in making extra profit on optional batteries at an increased cost.  To accept anything less than a rechargable battery will cost a fortune for regular alkaline batteries.  Rechargable batteries will cost nothing and produce hundred of photos per charge.

Reviews.Title: The last Kodak Camera I will ever buy.
Reviews.Author: Richard J. Schmitmeyer "PamnRick"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera 6 months ago.  It worked for 2 weeks then shut down while I was in video mode.  I contacted the seller and they refered me to a Kodak repair facility.  They had the camera for over a month for a cpu failure.  Got the camera back and it has problems focusing.  We contacted Kodak and that was a complete waste of time.  Sent the camera back to the repair facility.  They made adjustments and now about half of the pictures are blurry. Junk!  Throwing it away and buying a Sony Cybershot!

Reviews.Title: kodak z1485 any color
Reviews.Author: Nolen Clark
Reviews.Content: Not a good buy for the money, break easily, and pictures are not nearly as a good as a comparable Panasonic.  Warranty service takes forever and they have the worst phone menu, I have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera, with a slight flaw or two
Reviews.Author: D. Metz
Reviews.Content: First off, I always figure when I read half the electronics reviews on here three things:  a) every piece of electronics, due to the very nature of technology, is going to have lemons in the batch; b) easy as they may be and try as they might, some people are just inept when it comes to using devices like this; and c) people tend to go back and write reviews for items that they had problems with as a way to vent their anger.  Happy customers are less likely to take the time, especially if they received the item as a gift.That last part applies to me.  This review is different than some in that I didn't buy the device myself on here (although the gifter did) and I really am happy overall with it.  I am 40, a guy, and have always had an easy time figuring out new electronics items without reading a single page of the manual.  Kodak actually makes this easy because they haven't changed vastly the way their cameras work since they started making digital ones.They have improved upon them from my last generation owned, a five megapixel.  They now put a dedicated on/off button on them, which is nicer.  The number of dedicated modes for taking various types of pictures has increased drastically (including a "fireworks" mode, which I find weird and useless, but I'm sure some will like).Of the few negative comments I have about this device, the biggest by far is it ONLY taking lithium batteries.  Anybody who was excited or in a hurry could have easily shoved a set of alkaline batteries in it and ruined it.  It does come with a single use lithium battery, thankfully, but it's not the rechargeable kind (which is sold separately).  If it requires a lithium battery, devices shouldn't be physically capable of taking AA alkaline!  I haven't the camera long enough to know how long the battery that comes with it will last.Another negative is Kodak's EasyShare system.  Let's be honest here, it's nothing more than a poorly disguised store-front for them to sell products.  That's fine, but they need to just admit that and stop acting like they're giving us some great software.  The EasyShare software has never been great.  Version 7.1 came with my camera, but I have Windows 7 and had to download a later version (8.2).  It's function to look online for a later version doesn't work, nor does the link it gives for "more information."Anyway, in summary, this is an awesome little camera for the money!  Just be careful you don't put standard alkaline batteries in it, and go cautiously giving Kodak your personal info through the EasyShare software.  I recommend you don't even create an account with them.  They are a bit annoying.

Reviews.Title: Picture taking made easy
Reviews.Author: Joe W. Brown
Reviews.Content: This camera exceeded all my expectations. I had a digital camera and am an average photographer. This camera makes me look like a professional.  Joe W. Brown

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z1485IS a great little camera
Reviews.Author: M. J. Brett
Reviews.Content: Finally Kodak have got it right, this is an excellent little camera. 14mb with an easy to use menu system and good quality HD video.Combine this with Kodaks excellent picture quality and colour and youve got a real bargin for the price.Just remember get the rechargeable Lithium Ion battery and you wont have any battery problems. People need to understand the power drain on a unit like this is alot, consider processing 14mb, converting to jpeg, powering a 2.5" display, zoom motors and lots of other functions in the processing system, alkaline batterys just dont cut the mustard. The only complaint was that Kodak shipped my camera with alkaline batterys, not their best decision! Would recommend this camera to all amateur photographers,[...]

Reviews.Title: Don't be fooled by the 14MP, pic quality is still lacking
Reviews.Author: Ji1904
Reviews.Content: Now, if you are interested in this camera, then you were like me.  You did a bit of research and thought you found this "gem."  Low price, 14MP, can't go wrong right?  Well, I'm not even going to get into battery life and all that, as it has been covered by others.  I could have forgiven all it's little quirks if it had had exceptional picture quality, but it doesn't.  The pics more often than not show extremely "jagged" lines.  Not smooth at all and obviously not "realistic."  I do not believe that this camera is interpolated, but it might as well have been listed as such because it takes 5MP quality pictures with a 14MP nametag. Not sure why or how this occurs, I know it does occur with some interpolated cameras, or maybe a problem with the processor, who knows.  The fact of the matter is I bought this camera hoping for excellent picture quality and it's just not there.  Faces and such actually come out fairly well, but took some pictures of houses and cars and it looks as though someone drew straight lines on my pictures without a ruler.  It does have nice, vibrant colors, but that doesn't make up for it.  Compared to my Sony which is only 8MP (but was about twice the price tag a year ago) it is much, much worse.  Granted, it is fairly cheap and for the price tag it takes ok pics, but I can't look past this obvious flaw.  You are better off going with something else.  Just my 2 cents.

Reviews.Title: Kodak didn't get this camera right.
Reviews.Author: Lobol "lobol"
Reviews.Content: This is a genuine review.I did quite a bit of research before ending up with this camera from B&h.; I have had this camera for about 2 weeks now and tried most of what the camera can offer. This camera is ready to make its journey back to the dealer.Pros:1. Very portable.2. Takes AA batteries which makes it easy while travelling.3. Picture quality is generally good. Pictures in bright sunlight turns out really good. The other cameras that I tried before produces darker subjects when shot against a bright background.4. Smart Capture does ok and the camera comes with about 16 or so preset modes.Cons:1. The camera feels very delicate in your hand. At times, I was worried of scratching it while in my pocket or breaking the battery compartment accediently.2. The lens wobbles. The two sections of the lens touches each other when the camera is on and if you were to tilt it.3. Battery life is just not acceptable. I tried with 6 different kinds of batteries both lithium and NIMH high capacity batteries. They all died  after taking just 10- 15 pictures. The same set of batteries lasts a long long time in my canon S2is.4. Lag between shots is not acceptable as well. Both in smart mode and any scene mode the camera takes a good 6 to 7 seconds between shots. So you cannot go clicking snaps and this is very very irritating.5. If the battery dies, the camera gets stuck with the lens in the open position. This almost got me big time and luckly I had a set of charged batteries.6. The camera failed to read my new kingston 8gb card couple of times and I had to power it down and turn it on again to make it read the card again. All along it kept saying " Unable to read the card. Please replace your memory card". I got this card brand new from fry's an hour ago.7. The software that comes with the camera is a piece of junk. It doesn't let you store the pictures in a custom folder of your choice. It dumps them in the documents and setting/.../ folder.If you can put with up with its extremely high battery consumption  and if you can put up with its 5-6 seconds time between snaps and if you can take a chance with its delicate construction and unreliable hardware then go for it.I highly recommend to look at alternatives and don't let the 14mp "buzz word" trip you. We hardly need more than 6mp for regular photography and regular prints (unless you want to blow them up to super huge prints which is very unlikely for 95% of the users)Update 08/02/2009I ended up buying a panasonic DMC-LZ8k(Black) for lot less (Paid 99$) than Z1485 and I'm really happy with it's performance. I used the same set of batteries that I used with the Kodak z1485 and got hundreds of pictures without any problem. Lag between shots is minimal, camera feels really stong and reliable. IA mode works well in most of the situations, Low light performance is accetable, has full manual controls, bigger LCD. Have not seem any serious flaws with the camera so far.I'm planning to give this camera to my dad and get a panasonic DMC-ZS3 as soon as the prices drop a little bit which should happen in the next month or two. Costco sells DMC-ZS1 which is one level down and is pretty good as well for 240$

Reviews.Title: good little camera
Reviews.Author: JJ Arizona "JJ"
Reviews.Content: Good little camera, we use it for work. Had to get a large capacity memory card because we can take 200-300 pics in a day, also got rechargeable batteries to do so and have not had to change batteries mid-shoot since getting them. Totally worth the investment and Amazon had a variety of vendors who had these extras at very good prices. The camera was hard to find, searched the internet and only Amazon had it. Bought the first 2 at Office Max, but they no longer carry them and Kodak doesn't even have them on their site. We were looking for it because one was dropped (constructions quality is good, but not good enough to withstand butter fingers) and we like the camera enough to replace like for like instead of going with something new. It was pretty easy to figure out and the view screen is a nice size. A couple of negatives are that it doesn't have a viewfinder, just the view screen which is next to impossible to see outside in the daytime. It is also slow between shots, so if you are trying to capture something quickly and miss it with the first one, it will be gone by the time the camera resets for the next picture. It is also easy to accidentally change between video and still if you aren't paying attention to where your fingers are, but that might also be an operator issue, not a camera one.

Reviews.Title: Too many problems!
Reviews.Author: Whits01
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this camera for my birthday after our daughter was born.  I was anxious to capture all her memories on a high-MP camera!  My excitement was short-lived when the camera had many difficulties turning on.  The on/off light would blink on and then the camera would turn right off.  After about 20 tries the camera would come on, but by that time, the "moment" was over.  I struggled through this for a couple of months, and finally sent it in to get it fixed.  It worked ok for a while after that, but then I noticed that the battery was dead every time I needed to use the camera.  in order to preserve the life of the batteries, I ended up having to take the battery out in between each use.  This has become a hassle as well.  A few months ago, I noticed that the camera started dropping the last picture I took.  This is the most frustrating, because if I'm trying to get a picture of my daughter, the last picture is usually the "keeper," so I stop taking pictures after I get the one I want.  When I upload pictures on my computer, the good one if gone!I emailed Kodak and they told me that since it's been over a year since the camera was purchased, I can either get 15% off a new camera or spend $90 to get this one fixed again.  Neither is a acceptable option for me!

Reviews.Title: Great "point & shoot" & "video quality", but why only .mov files, Kodak??
Reviews.Author: Ana "visual artist"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for over a year now and overall, I love it.  I bought it primarily for two reasons.  For the 14.1 mega-pixels (to take good, detailed photos of my artwork) and for the HD video possibilities (videos for YouTube).My main complaint is that in the product description it says the video format is either .mov or .mpeg.  I'm fairly good with gadgets and techno things and I could never find how to switch the format to .mpeg, so that you can edit your videos using Windows Movie Maker (which is my favorite method of editing, simply because it's fast, easy & what I was use to).SO, I ended up calling Kodak customer service and  it was based out of India [complaint #2].  This was extremely frustrating, because although basic communication was possible...there are nuances in language that only someone from your country can understand.  If it were an American on the line, we would have understood each other much more easily and although I probably would have been equally frustrated, I would have felt like at least I was able to get my point across.  That experience was nothing short of torture, only to find out that all Kodak cameras produce only the .mov format.So I ended up having to get another video editor, learn how to use it, etc. If you have a good computer that is not clogged up with programs,etc...you'll be able to easily handle the huge memory that the HD videos have, but because my computer is older, I record my videos in 640x480 HQ and they're equally as good (and much faster to edit).The photo qualities are obviously very good, even at the 5.0 mp format (which is what I typically use for everyday photos).  You have the choice of several formats (which is nice): 2.4, 2.8, 3.1, 3.8, 4.5, 5.0. 10.7, 12.6 and 14.2 megapixels, so you can adjust the file size, depending on what your needs are.There are a lot of advanced features on this camera that I have either yet to use, or don't really have a need for (exposure, aperture, etc.), so I cannot comment much on those, other than to say that I think this camera would be fun for the very amateur, to the professional photographer. For the amateur, the "scene" choices for the auto setting are nice and easy. The settings are: portrait, sport, landscape (distance), night portrait, night landscape, snow, beach, text for documents), fireworks, flower (this is the macro setting), museum, self-portrait, stage, backlight, candle light & sunset.  And they have a quick description on the screen of what each is for.What else...The 5x zoom leaves much to be desired, as it really doesn't make much of a difference.I highly recommend buying the Kodak Digital Camera Battery (3.7v)- It's a re-chargable Li-Ion battery (KLIC-8000).  If you can afford to get two, even better...that way you always have a battery on hand.  I feel the charge lasts a long time on this battery, but can't give you an exact time (check out other reviews for the battery).So, overall, I like this camera and would never have considered returning it, despite the fact that I got it primarily to make videos (with the bonus feature of high mega pixels for photos) and I couldn't edit them using my favorite video editor.  I will be getting a camcorder soon and will leave this camera just for my detailed photos.I hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: A Fair Camera on Auto, a Better Camera in Program Mode.
Reviews.Author: ESRick "Richard"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera since early December 2009.  At first I didn't really like it.  Most of the pictures had a reddish cast to them when I used the fully automatic setting with Perfect Touch.  I started using Program Mode and setting the ISO to 80, with the rest set to Auto, unless it was for a closeup.  Then I used either the Flower symbol, or Manual Focus.  My pictures were now coming out very good, and sometimes spectacular for such a small camera.  The sensor in this camera is much bigger than most point and shoots, so it does low light photography without a flash pretty well with the proper settings.  The camera rarely blows out the highlights and has very good dynamic range handling (bright and darker areas in the same image).  And you can always adjust the exposure a little to compensate, but I never seem to have to use that feature.The only real problem I have had with the camera has been some difficultly seeing the LCD outside in bright light.  I can see the outline of what I am shooting, but no details, so it is a bit of hit or miss as to whether I got a good shot or not.  Of course most cameras without a dedicated viewfinder are similar in this regard, but a lot of them do have much brighter screens, or more than two brightness settings.Another potential problem is with the camera eating batteries, but I bought two rechargeable L-Ion batteries and a charger at the same time I bought the camera and have had no problems.  I always carry the spare battery with me when taking pictures.  The camera slows down considerably as the battery runs down, but not using the Auto Perfect Touch makes a big difference in the time it takes for the camera to process the image between shots and how long your battery lasts.  And you can always add Perfect Touch processing to a picture while it is still in the camera if it needs some contrast or brightness adjustment like with a face being too dark with a bright background.Overall, this is a nice little camera for the price.  It has full manual controls available, a few manual controls if that's all you want, or a fairly good Auto Mode.  Using Program Mode with everything on auto turns off the Perfect Touch and speeds up the camera and makes your battery last longer.  For me, my pictures seem to turn out better in this mode.This camera is basically a poor mans Canon G10 with the same size 1/1.7 inch sensor, 14.7 mega pixels, and similar 28-140mm 5X optical zoom lens for one third of the price.  But like the Canon G10, only if you take the time learn to use it properly in something other than Auto will it give you the best results.  I got mine for $99 new, so I am way ahead of the game  The Kodak case, off brand batteries and charger cost an additional $35 or so and were all well worth it. I use a 16 gig class 6 SDHC memory card and have tons of room for pictures and HD video.

Reviews.Title: I would get a different camera
Reviews.Author: Coffee Lover
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone,I felt I needed a write a review on this camera. I have always went with Canon cameras, most recently the powershot A470 which has been a great litle camera, but I was impressed with the high mp's on this Kodak.  Well, I should have stuck with Canon. I have had it for a couple months and I am not impressed.  I am going back to my other camera.  The problems I have had... and yes, I have used all the different settings are:1.  Blurry pictures2.  lighting/exposure issues in many picturesThese two alone are big ones considering the pics are ruined.As I said, I am going to stop using this camera and go back to my Canon.I hope this helps you in your decision making.Have a nice day!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Walcott "family historian"
Reviews.Content: Great Camera, Does not come with rechargeable battery or any cord for downloading, etc, Overall Great Buy.

Reviews.Title: Cool camera, but be prepared for battery expenses
Reviews.Author: Cali Girl "Cali Girl"
Reviews.Content: I love the camera, but it comes with 1 battery that is not rechardgeable.  It does not take regular rechargeable batteries that other digital cameras take.  It only takes a special battery that is not cheap.  I hated finding this out the hard way.  I thought I was set for a trip and found out otherwise. I spent too much time and money trying to figure out whats wrong with my camera cause the lens would open and stay open.  there was no low battery indicator.  This information should be listed when you purchase the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Lalit Chilana
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after doing a lot of research. I am a kodak user so i was aware about the quality of the product. Few things which i was looking for were Megapixals, Zooming capacity, Modes (Auto, Manual, and Program) and also the price. I found this camera on amazon and bought it immediately. This is a 14 mp camera with 5x optical zoom. It comes with Auto, Manual, and Program Modes. It is really compact and is very good companion in case of travel. The camera is full of features and is very affordable.I am not a professional but i love to take photos and i have tried all the different settings to understand this camera in a better way. For people who have a good sense of photography, they can have great pictures with this camera b'coz it provides you a chance to select your own mode. You can use Auto mode which is great for beginners or the people who just wants to take photos without breaking their heads. Manual & Program Mode is good for more advanced people and It works really great in both the modes. It also lets you capture the video in HD mode which is really good. You can check out this link for results ([...]). I took this video with this camera and it came out really nice even though i was a bit shaky b'coz of the cold ;). Unlike most of the other cameras you can use the zoom during the video mode which is a plus point.Usually picture comes out very nice but basically it depends upon an individual. If used with proper settings, it can produce great results but if not then it will make you cry. This condition is applicable to all other cameras of the similar categories. There is a High ISO mode for taking pictures with very low light conditions but i have not used it till now. This cameras offers around 17 scenery modes which can be used with ease. The only thing that made me sad was that kodak did not offer a charger with this camera. I spent another 25 bucks for the rechargeable battery & charger. But the total cost of the camera & charger is still very less compared to other cameras with all these features. I am very pleased with my purchase and would recommend this camera to anyone who wants more than the usual camera within a reasonable range.

Reviews.Title: great size and picture quality
Reviews.Author: Barbara Hodge
Reviews.Content: My previous Kodak CX7530 has not been keeping a charge so I needed a back-up camera for traveling.  I was not so interested in the 14MP but wanted a strong zoom feature.  My son has the z812 which I borrowed and loved but I couldn't afford one.When Amazon had this camera on sale for $99 I couldn't pass it up. It is actually smaller than the CX.  My complaint would be that the on/off button is very tiny.I also hate the software for both cameras and prefer using Adobe.  When I wanted to download pictures with USB, I actually spent 1 1/2 hours on the phone with tech support and was so frustrated I was about to return it.  I solved the problem by just inserting the SD card into my computer which activated the Adobe download.  For general picture taking I am happy that you can select a lower MP so that they are easier to edit and send.  When I want 14mp I have it.I am an artist and take photos of my oil paintings.  This camera is awesome in capturing the detail and colors.  I am just learning about all the functions in the menu.  I would say the instruction booklet is minimal so will have to spend extra time with the on-board help.  For stills it is a superb camera.  For video, the one I took at Christmas was awful.  I have purchased the rechargable KLIC-8000 with battery charger and a 2GB SD card so will see how these work down the road.Overall, I am happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Best Christmas Present Ever
Reviews.Author: trinichiq
Reviews.Content: I bought this for myself for Christmas, it was time for an upgrade. The pictures are crisp, the quality is amazing. I can put tags on the pictures. The LCD does not show you how great the picture really is and it still looks good on the LCD. I am using a 4GB SDHC card, I don't know if this has anything to do with it but I am loving what I am getting. Deleting is easy and apparently reversible (although I have not tried that yet). Movement does not look ridiculously blurry. I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: D. M. Santos "Lysta"
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome!!! Takes much better pics than I could on other cameras. The battery life does go fast but I have already experienced that with other cameras. I noticed some blurry pics but soon discovered how to use the settings properly and after that pics are always Perfect!!! It is pretty simple to use. I already have gotten compliments on the clarity of the pics even when zoomed in on top of the pic already being a zoomed picture!!! I would recommend this camera to any amatuer looking to take great pics.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: CTBigdog "CTBigdog"
Reviews.Content: We needed to upgrade our old camera as we just had a little girl joing our family two weeks ago. My wife was always complaining about the "delay" in the our old picture when she was trying to capture a smile from our kids. This camera eliminated the delay. Sure, we wanted to get a nice Canon for $500+ but we really can't afford it. The bottom line is if you want a great camera that shoots awesome pictures-combined with a great price. Get this. However, the battery that comes with it really bites. As with all the other reviewers, but the lithium battery and charger. I got my camera for $99.00 and I signed up for pricespider...they will email you prices on all sorts of stuff. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Kurz
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera when my C875 died (accident, no fault of Kodak).  I mainly do photography as a hobby, but I'm constantly taking professional quality pics of my own children and friends' children.  I really wanted to splurge and get an SLR, but this little beauty caught my eye.  14.2 mega pixels for under $200!?!  I'm so glad I gave it a chance.  Once again Kodak has made me very happy.  This little camera takes amazing pictures.  They are so crisp and clear that nearly every shot I take is stunning...and considering that my subjects are a one year old and three year old that's really saying something.  Both the preset and manual settings are very easy to use and once you've played with them a while it isn't hard to have your pictures turn out perfect.  I've also found that the size of the camera is a plus.  It's small enough to travel well, yet it isn't flat and tiny like some other point and shoots.  Maybe it's just me, but it's nice to have something to hold on to.All in all, this is an awesome little camera for your money and I would definitely recommend it!  The picture quality is amazing.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: H. Mayer
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this camera.  The pictures are clear, and generally bright enough on the smart capture setting.  For weird lighting, the manual functions work well, and I like having the options.  I also own a manual SLR camera, so it's nice to have a little more custamizability in my digital.  My old one had basically none, just the settings it came with.  My only complaint is that it doesn't come with an internal lithium ion battery so that you can charge just by plugging in the camera.  But I bought the klic-8000 li-ion battery and a charger for that, and it works great.  14 mp for only about $170?  Yes please.

Reviews.Title: Kodak z1485 IS
Reviews.Author: Kayaksach
Reviews.Content: Searching for a pocket digital was like entering a maze. Which way to turn, features, megapixels, color, cost and the list goes on. The Kodak z1485 IS seemed to fit the bill for everything except (for my needs, wet weather conditions). First impressions were very good. A small learning curve had to be tackled with various settings, etc. I was a dedicated 35mm guy since my junior high school days. I had a couple of opportunities to field test my purchase and then hit a figurative brick wall. The view screen stopped working and I was shooting in the dark because that's what the result was when I depressed the shutter. The camera was never dropped, kicked, spindled, mutilated or exposed to water. Even when attached to a PC - nothing. Any previously taken photographs could be reviewed downloaded, etc.Reader's Digest version of subsequent events - surgery was performed(yes I voided any warranty anywhere in that act) and  - IT'S ALIVE -again. The only issue I can confidently comment on is that that a set of three wires (white, red, green) above and to the left of the lens module may of been the culprit. The white and red wire solder points were shorting each other. Once seperated the camera functions as normal.Would I purchase this product again? I believe that, for me, it's too early to tell. I'll revisit that decision in a couple of months. At this point my optimism prevails.

Reviews.Title: a camera worth its price
Reviews.Author: Arvind D. Desai "snap shooter"
Reviews.Content: this is my first digital camera and I used it during my trip to Peru. It was easy to carry around and use and the pictures came out vivid and clear. The camera has some nice features and I was able to take pictures in different weather conditions.I am quite happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Superb camera
Reviews.Author: Calvin E. Boyles "Cal Boyles"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to replace a Olympus Stylus 1030 SW which I had lost.  This is he first Kodak I have owned since my pre-teen years.  I was pleasantly surprised when I took my first pictures...the colors are so brilliant and lifelike, and the crispness of the images is equal to that of a studio camera.  With an 8 meg card, I can take 1811 pictures at full 12 megapixels. The 5X telephoto capability allows me to zoom in and frame high quality pictures at long ranges - great for action shots and landscapes.  Bottom line - well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Moment Indeed!
Reviews.Author: Steve Smith "SteveLovesGod"
Reviews.Content: This product is outstanding. I purchased this Camera. It pleased me and exceeded my expectations for the price. The batteries that comes with the batteries last a nice amount of time. Do not by Duracell or energizer rechargeable batteries. They suck for HD digital cameras. The Camera records in 720 HD. Thats a great feature for a digital camera. You have to purchase an HD memory card. Great feature of the Camera is it uses sd cards and HCSD cards. So i used an HD-HCSD 16GB card! This picture quality is sharp. The Flash is Amazingly bright. I recommend this camera. The 14 Megapixels and Hd quality means more memory used, so don't cheap out on the batteries and memory card. I'm a well pleased customer. I have a kodak camera for My KODAK MOMENTS!

Reviews.Title: High Megapixel still rules
Reviews.Author: Highland Rock
Reviews.Content: A very well designed camera. Image is far superior than my Olympus 8 MP FE370 especially using zoom -- That shows a higher megapixel still rules in digital camera. Panoramic stitching is a fun feature for outdoor shots. HD recording is also a useful plus. Shot to shot time delay is about 5 seconds @14MP.  Picture stays true to life under well lighted condition. At low light, the picture is a little soft but everything looks great (so who cares). Instead of using the battry came with the package, I used two Energizer 2500 mAh AA rechargeables to test the camera; after some 270 shots, it still hops. Well organized controls makes the operation easy. It is a wonderful camera without taking you to the cleaner.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Z14585 (14 megapixel)
Reviews.Author: Deborah Bartow "PMS247"
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Kodak EasyShare Z14585 IS.  It is one of the worst camera's we have ever owned.  It is okay to take 'still' pictures but the least movement and there is a blur. And yes we used different settings. We were hoping that the 14 megapixel would let us blow up the image larger then our 8.1 megapixel but there is little to no difference in the images.We take A LOT Of pics during our chilren's sporting events. Can't use a camera that wont permit any action so we went back to using our old Kodak EasyShare ZD8612 IS for that. That Kodak is great with movement.Would I recommend the Z14585??? Yes if you are taking picture of plants, or trees but not for normal family pictures.

Reviews.Title: Loved it at first but now smart phones do the same job
Reviews.Author: Extremely happy
Reviews.Content: Although I loved this camera when we first got it, like most cameras, it has been replaced by smart phones.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Earl, Construction Manager.
Reviews.Content: Great Lens.  The pictures are clear and flawless, even at incredibly high speed stop action snaps of machining tools in motion.  Easy to use and focus.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Camer
Reviews.Author: Kathleen A. Dove
Reviews.Content: I love the camera and it works well.  Only problem was there was no charger for the battery.  I was able to overcome this problem as I had a battery and charger from my last camera.  Unfortunately the new battery did not work well with my charger.  I did appreciate the patch cord they included.Camera arrived promptly.

Reviews.Title: After the 30 days it started to shoot discolored pictures.
Reviews.Author: Harry Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera because my wife broke mine. I love Kodak but this camera sucks because its used, won't do that again.

Reviews.Title: My Favorite Camera
Reviews.Author: Heather M. Era "Zaftig, Brown Eyed, Brunette."
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for the past few years and I must say, by far my favorite camera I've ever owned. The picture quality is amazing, the grip on the side of the camera is perfect, great battery life. More "scene" features than you can shake a stick at.Only negatives is the battery, and the video option. The battery (when one hasn't purchased a rechargeable), MUST be a Lithium Ion AA battery. If it is not Lithium, the camera won't work. It's actually fine because electronics work longer when one uses Lithium batteries as opposed to regular. The other point I mentioned is the video option. There is one, but I HIGHLY recommend not using it. Every time I've tried it has either messed up my camera, or stopped working all together.There is a Tripod mount on the bottom and this has such great features that I can give it such a high rating despite the obvious downfalls. Even though it's a few years old, I haven't seen one on the market at this price point that even remotely compares to it.

Reviews.Title: Reliable Product
Reviews.Author: Judy A. Nicewicz
Reviews.Content: Glad I purchased this product... works great,  I have used it for a long time and very pleased with the results.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara Christian
Reviews.Content: this camera is not like a new one  It has some problems-the seller could not tell this with out using it  So i give him that he didn't know that.  I am keeping the camera .  I can use it.

Reviews.Title: fun, easy to use, with good options
Reviews.Author: Chicago Al "Chicago Al"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera-  it's a great companion all day.  It can be very simple to use or if you choose, it allows for lots of control & input.  The lens is exceptional; the image quality- great; and the overall design is well-thought out.  It's a very nice little package.  Even the battery options are very versatile.  This camera doesn't try to do everything-- silly, but gives you a good & basic combination of features.  The camera seems to be laid out to help you GET THE PICTURE!  Unless you have a very specific need/requirement, this compact is tough to beat.

Reviews.Title: Great while it lasted
Reviews.Author: THE GUNSMITH "lnc"
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera. great controls,good feastures for all round usage.(Inow have upgraded maybe 7 times to keep up with the digital camera technical progress. Thi was one of the most satisfactory easy picture taking,good pictures like hummingbird in flight by feeder.portraits After having the camera over a year, it began to eat the memory cards. Wetting them with my tongue helped for a while but it then ate three memory cards (unfixable) So I assigned it to the scrap heap and replaced it with a Kodak 1550.Nocomparison in workmanship, quality etc.What other alternative do you have when camera fails not too long after warranty.Ironcrossguns August 23,2012

Reviews.Title: horrible camera and kodak customer service
Reviews.Author: bellibutton
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and was disappointed from day one. my first problem was that it went through batteries too quickly. 15 photos and the batteries were out. Overtime it decreased to 10 pictures... then 6. i should have taken it back right then. instead I barely used it... waiting only for the right moment to take a picture in order to save my batteries.  6 months later i'm going on a trip and i pulled out the camera, filled it with fresh new batteries and tried again. this time it would turn on, blink a couple times then automatically shut itself off. very frustrating. it couldn't even take one little picture.  i called where i origiinally purchased it from who could do nothing except tell me to contact kodak to explain. So i called and complained. That was where i was truly disappointed at their customer service. Not very helpful at all. i only had two options: 1. get it repaired at my cost...which would have been at least $100 or 2. get %15 off any of their products. As if  i would buy another kodak product in my lifetime after this experience. i think not.i would never recommend this camera or the kodak brand to anyone.i understand that products break over time, but you hope that they at least work and last for some time so you get your money's worth.this didn't work from the start. and my only regret is that i didn't complain from day one.

Reviews.Title: Excelente camara por el precio que pagas
Reviews.Author: Rjimenez
Reviews.Content: Excelente camara para uso casero, la elegi porque usaba la misma bateria que mi antigua camara IZ812 y las fotos son de muy buena calidad, lo unico en contra, el autofocus es a veces un poco lento, de resto, excelente camara familiar. La tengo desde hace un mes nada mas, pero espero que su duracion alcance a mi antigua IZ que tiene 3 años y sigue como si nada.El tiempo de entrega fue exactamente el prometido

Reviews.Title: love my camera
Reviews.Author: Rebekah Alexander
Reviews.Content: This camera is a take anywhere camera.  Took it on a recent fishing trip and came home with awesome pics.  Being able to use different batteries really makes it easy to take and have available when ever.  The zoom on it took excellent pictures of Mt McKinley!

Reviews.Title: Worse Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: Lizcor
Reviews.Content: I had this camera six months and it crapped out. The picture quality was hit and miss. Some pictures turned out great and the rest were fuzzy. Do not buy this camera it is cheap for areason.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Daividh
Reviews.Content: the camera is one of the best purchases i've made in a long time online.......

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare
Reviews.Author: peace
Reviews.Content: Great features, share capabilities, good zoom, motion pictures.  I would purchase this product or a newer version.

Reviews.Title: The Camera Is impressive for the price(78)
Reviews.Author: Sahira Fontana "Mr.Pavy"
Reviews.Content: This is my first camera I ever bought And i like to take pictures and record funny/nature/Animals i recorded Some videos,Dont Be Fooled by the playback quality on the camera.test it on your computer to get the full HD Quality.But there is one odd thing i dont get If you record at night thee quality will suck a bit but if its in Daytime It great

Reviews.Title: Loved it until it quit
Reviews.Author: green mom
Reviews.Content: I always read reviews before I buy almost anything. I read many, many reviews before purchasing a digital camera. I decided on this one mostly due to reviews, the ease of use and the features. I think I may have even written an outstanding review for the camera. What I hate is that after the newness wears off people don't review the product anymore. When you first get something and it works well and you are happy it is easy to write the review but how does the product hold up? Does the picture quality hold up?I have owned this camera for 1 1/2 years and now it doesn't work. First, all my pictures looked like they had heat waves coming off from them and then the screen went black and all my pictures came out black. Also, as time went by my face reecongition faded as did the crispness and clearness of my pictures. Now I am scrambling to buy a new camera. I did love the photos the camera took and its total ease of use. I just wish I had bought the extended plan so I could get it fixed.Two other little things, it never worked with my easyshare dock (and it should have it was the correct dock, called the company to confirm) and the batteries that were in camera didn't work in the charger I purchased to charge them (it was a Kodak charger) so my extra set of batteries that came with the charger ended up being my only batteries for the camera.

Reviews.Title: shipping disappointment
Reviews.Author: sscott
Reviews.Content: Ordered the camera on the 18th for 2 day shipping. Paid extra for this and we still won't receive it for 5 days. Very disappointed. Questionable whether we will order from this site again

Reviews.Title: killer kodak
Reviews.Author: Anthony Dimino "adimino"
Reviews.Content: this point and shoot is superb for outdoor photos.the image quality is quite out standing for such a affordable camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for one low price $ 99
Reviews.Author: Jhonny Rosales
Reviews.Content: excellent camera for only $ 99 I am very happy and satisfied with the quality of the pictures and the battery performs much volume to over 100 150 photos with flash and still intact, this camera is ideal for those who we like a simple camera but high quality 100% recommended .. from Venezuela

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: Quin 2013
Reviews.Content: I was in the market to purchase a good quality camera for my girlfriend for Christmas, instead I found this incredible and very affordable, AWESOME Pixalation camera!!!!I & my girlfriend couldn't be any more happy. The pix are just great. 14.5 HD pics, video and sound quality. super easy to use.One suggestion, make sure to purchase the rechargeable battery, it will make your life a lot easier. It can't get any easier with this camera. We take it with us all the time every where.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: Roseanne G.
Reviews.Content: I have purchased and returned several camera's of different brands b/c I thought I should upgrade to a camera with a better zoom.  Boy was I wrong! All the camera's I tried were sent back and I decided to stick with my original Kodak Z1485. The pictures are crisp "every time!" I'm always taking pictures of my children & family and this gets the job done. The quality of the pictures I take are truly amazing!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: P. Summitt "P. Summitt"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great digital camera at a great price.....look no further.  I was amazed at  how great the pictures turned out.  And the ease of use is head and shoulders above the other brands I have tried.  I just sold my Canon because of the complicated menus and lag time.  This Kodak has virtually no lag time and pictures I took out the side window of my speeding auto were perfect.  Menu set up was very intuitive.  No need for a manual in order to make really great pictures.  Even at night.....in the dark!  It is small enough to carry in my purse and  I purchased the camera dock which keeps the batteries always fully charged and ready in an instant.  The only complaint I have is with the EasyShare software which comes with the camera.  That software is in dire need of an overhaul.  And while the camera is very easy to figure out.;...I have yet to figure out that stupid software.  I just go to My computer and go through my camera usb hook up and open and move picture where I want them.  The older version of the Easyshare software would download and deposit your picture in the Pictures folder on your computer.  But no so with this version.  But the camera itself is well worth the money and I promise you won't be dissapointed.  I have found Kodak brand cameras to be very reliable.  I have another one that is about 8 years old and still makes beautiful pictures.  I also purchased a Kodak ESP 7250 all in one printer and the camera works great with it.  I would give it 10 stars if that were possible.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z1485
Reviews.Author: R. Cole
Reviews.Content: My friend got this stolen after she had it only 6 months.  She liked it so much that I bought her the same one to replace it.  This camera works fine.I wish it had come with a rechargeable battery and charger unit and also an audio cable for viewing on the TV.  I had to purchase these items separately.Other than the lack of included accessories, it seems to be a nice camera.  I cannot give a more more detailed evaluation because I have not used it that much myself.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Point and Shoot with HD Video and Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: dudeofswim
Reviews.Content: This is a great Point and Shoot for people who want high quality photos! The zoom is decent. The pictures turn up great! The video is HD.The auto mode is good. Sometimes it misses the focus but thats rare and fixable in program mode. The videos again are great and the pictures are really really good.Cons: Battery life if you are using just plain ol AA batterys (DONT!) It's not compatible. While you are buying it , buy 2 or 3 disposable CRV3 batteries! Then you will really see the advantage. The battery life is great with the crv3 batteries plain ol AA wont give you much (because its not supported) Also 1700+ NiMH AA are good too. Just not plain old alkalines. Got like maybe 20 shots from 2 alkaline. USE THE RIGHT BATTERY! sometimes misses some shots , but you need to get a fast sd card to prevent that. Not a biggie.Also sometimes slow into going into playback modeI paid a really low price for it and it was well worth that!Good for families

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA - GREAT PRICE
Reviews.Author: Barbara Mcallister "BB"
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning the ins and outs of this camera. But the photos I have taken are just beautiful. Great color and very easy to use! I recommend this camera for those who like to set their own settings or for those who don't and still want great shots. This camera allows both!

Reviews.Title: Way cool 5X zoom hi-res Kodak!  Love it!
Reviews.Author: David S. Palmer
Reviews.Content: Kodak quality, great optics, over-the-top resolution, boughtine as a refurb for $99.  That's a steal.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z1485
Reviews.Author: Samuel E. Burgess "SEB"
Reviews.Content: Good pictures, decent videos, fits is shirt pocket.  "Normal" AA batteries do not last long, must use the "Super-Duper expensive batteries to avoid shutdown right when you are ready for a picture.

Reviews.Title: Kodak easy share Z1485
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: so far we really like the camera.  Great value on the day I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: jlraley
Reviews.Author: Jerry E. Raley
Reviews.Content: Camera is very good but hard to use by older people. Basically most newer technology products are harder to use by older people because they are so small. Size does matter.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: Melvin Bosarreyes "Mel"
Reviews.Content: It's a perfect camera for beginners, the quality is not that perfect but close enough, I would recommend this camera to a person who is taking family pictures and is not tech knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: Love my camera
Reviews.Author: C. D. Landry "avon lover"
Reviews.Content: I received this identical camera as a Christmas gift from my husband, who bought it at Wal-Mart.  I used it a few days and at a friend's house, the camera accidentally fell from a table onto a thickly carpeted floor - the camera completely quit working - there was nothing at all broken on the camera - but something obviously was wrong with it.  I took the camera back to Wal-Mart, where they took it back with no questions asked.  I repurchased this identical camera here on Amazon.  My only remark is that if you have this camera or are looking to purchase this camera, you MUST be very, very careful with it and try to avoid accidents like this - as it seems to be ultra-sensitive!!  Had this camera fallen on a concrete floor or a hard floor, I could see the problem, but when it fell onto the thickly carpeted floor and didn't make a sound, and then didn't work anymore, it shows me that this camera is very, very delicate.  So far, my new camera has worked exceptionally well and I've been extremely careful with it.

Reviews.Title: Kodak easy share
Reviews.Author: R. chemmannu "RP"
Reviews.Content: This camera is giving me nightmares!!I had used several batteries ( as per the specification ) and still its not working, it blinks and then it goes off!!I bought this during the month of december 2009 and unfortunately I used it twice or thrice during december and it just blinks whenever I try to switch it on.Is there a way I can return this and get the refund..Pls help!!

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: T. Benn
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome.  The picture quality is great.  You don't have that annoying lag time that occurs before you can take another picture like with other digital cameras.  This is the camera I was waiting for.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Deal
Reviews.Author: E. Beam
Reviews.Content: I was able to catch this camera on a very good sale.  Haven't had much chance to use it, but I am quite happy so far.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size---Beautiful pictures
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Porteous
Reviews.Content: I have used the camera for scenery as well as close ups of items to sell on the internet.  It does the job. Fits right in shirt pocket.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't do what is says it will and web site not appl for this model.
Reviews.Author: Loki_77573
Reviews.Content: Camera set on auto and still got red eyes indoors, and tried auto and specific setting to take a picture at dusk which is just a blur of lights. Went to website as directed and it doesn't cover this camera.  So I have a pricey disposable with the ability to enlarge my bad photos to poster size.  However I still hope to find there is actually a simple fix.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Jeff Smith
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for $99.99 during this past Cyber-Monday weekend. I have used this camera at a recent party. This camera has a lot of features. The video playback is excellent. The only flaw is the battery power. It comes with a lithium battery, and it didn't last long. Also, the camera does not use regular alkaline batteries. You need to get KLIC-8000 rechargeable batteries. Other than that, this camera is a lot more than what i paid for.

Reviews.Title: Battery Type
Reviews.Author: RJ
Reviews.Content: Kodak EasyShare Z1485 14MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5 inch LCD (Blue)Hello,Somebody know, what type a battery needed to this camera, i used sanyo eneloop rechargable battery, but when use more them 5 shots appear on the screen battery low, and the camera power down.Any help, realy and very fine with resolution and picture, but not cant be used.Note: I have another kodak camera (12 MP Digital) and not have problem.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Z1485 Camera
Reviews.Author: Donald Hanson "Don Hanson"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera for the money.  In fact, I liked it so much that I bought a 2nd one for a Christmas present for a family member.  He also loves it.  My wife likes it because it is so simple to use.  Within 5 minutes she was taking pictures like a pro.  The pictures are great with the exception of the panoramic shots.  The camera is supposed to stitch them together but it doesn't do it well at all.  The only negative thing about this camera is that it does not have a viewfinder.  That's why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.  When in sunlight, it is very difficult to see the LCD screen.  But, if you just point and shoot, you usually get a pretty good picture.  A viewfinder would solve this problem.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera...
Reviews.Author: T. Templeton "tt"
Reviews.Content: Camera takes great shots... in a gym bad light situation also!!!  So easy to use!!!

Reviews.Title: Z1485 IS
Reviews.Author: Mom to a monkey "Kim L"
Reviews.Content: I love Kodak cameras and this is a great upgrade from the Z1285. Plus the service from Amazom was fantastic. I got the camera within 3 days of ordering - a week before it was scheduled to arrive.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z1485 Review
Reviews.Author: FromTheMoonToHeaven "AdGloriamDei"
Reviews.Content: Overall this camera is pretty good.  The panoramic feature is my favorite.  I dislike the movie feature because it records in apple quicktime format only.  Also, when I play the video from the sd card on my computer, the video is not smooth and plays slowly.  The video plays well in the camera only.  I have purchased the cradle and hope playback directly from the camera to my TV will be better. This camera is a good buy at $99, but the current price makes it less of a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Battery Compartment not good
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Love to Boat"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes nice pictures- but it burns through batteries pretty fast, and I like to use AA lithiums- well even though the manual says they work, the battery compartment door doesn't close tightly so that there is always contact- my camera would then not always work- you have to buy the more expensive CRV3 battery to always have contact- and it'll burn pretty quick through those, too.I'll be returning mine, and going back to Canon (I lost my Canon Powershot).  This is the second Kodak I've tried and the construction of their cameras just doesn't seem very good.  Nice features, nice pictures, poor quality construction.Also- be careful if you buy your camera through another store at Amazon- Amazon has a great return policy, their stores here may not- I have to pay a 10% restocking fee, plus return shipping, and I only had 15 days to try the camera (luckily I decided to do the return within 13 days).  READ THE STORES RETURN POLICY BEFORE BUYING, I didn't.

Reviews.Title: Solid choice
Reviews.Author: Andy Coffland
Reviews.Content: I had an older Kodak digital so chose this partially due to familiarity with function. Is very simple to use and has a lot of flexibility. I like the large LCD screen and intuitive controls. Great all around camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Jason Jimenez
Reviews.Content: This camera is absolutely amazing! It is compact inexpensive and takes the most wonderful pictures. It is very easy to use and the dial that Kodak uses makes it simple to understand for any user. It is by far my favorite camera.

Reviews.Title: Kodaks Easy Share's are Just that EASY
Reviews.Author: Barbara Gagliardi "CoconutGirl1961"
Reviews.Content: THE best cameras of the Kodak family of camera and the only one I will personally buy.

Reviews.Title: Good product and excellent price!
Reviews.Author: J. A. Picon "Corlo"
Reviews.Content: I think this is a good product, I had used Kodak cameras before and always had excellent pictures. I had used it just a few times but I think it's excellent for the price it has. It's a 14 Mpixels camera! If you prefer pictures rather than videos this is a perfect choice. But if like more videos you should choose another one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.  Lots to learn but worth it.
Reviews.Author: V. Edwards "horse nut"
Reviews.Content: In need of a new camera, we searched out a new Kodak EasyShare.  The one we had was a K ES and we like them.  I found this item and compared it with a few other Kodak cameras and found that this is the one to try.I enjoy this camera so much.  There is more to learn for me, but I enjoy playing with it while shooting pics, finding out what works best for each situation.The HD quality is pretty nice to have, and videos come out great.This is a camera I would suggest to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but no charger
Reviews.Author: Majiangyu
Reviews.Content: The camera is good. Easy to use and it takes very clear photos. But I had to order a charger for it, Which you don't need to do if you buy most of the cameras. But oh well, you can always use AA battery for it.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: S. Bevis "suzi bevis"
Reviews.Content: i just love this camera. it takes great pictures, is easy to use and easy to understand. it fits in your purse. buy one and you will love it too.

Reviews.Title: Very good compact camera
Reviews.Author: J. Aclan
Reviews.Content: takes very good pictures  --even indoors, low-lit condition.picture quality are comparable to digital SLRs.Preset scenes are good, but real fun photography begins with manual settings.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: The review title says it all. Great camera for the price. Easy to use, nice battery life, no cons at all in my opinion. I got what I expected for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: Battery Hog
Reviews.Author: Bill S.
Reviews.Content: An OK camera except for two items. 1 Not having a view finder makes it hard to take picture in daylight.  2 With the IS on it eats batteries, an probably with it off.  With cheap batteries it gets less than 5 pics per set.  With the best set of Energizer Ultimate Lithium from Walmart at $9.00 + per 4 pk. I get less than 40 pics.  I have spent more on batteries than the Camera.  It won't even run on recharables.  Done with Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Not quite what you think it might be
Reviews.Author: A. Caton
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera after reading reviews.  I had an "old" easy share camera with a view finder that still takes great pictures.  Wanted a newer model with better zoom.
