The zoom works fine HOWEVER while trying to take any outside pictures in the sun it is impossible to see what is being photographed!  The screen seems to black out in the sun so you have to guess what you are shooting. No view finder at all.Managed to get some great pictures on vacation but now the entire camera seems to have imploded.  Everything has turned wavy, grainy, and no pictures are printable.I was disappointed before but now will have to buy a new camera.  Am thinking buying on line is not the best way to get a camera.

Reviews.Title: Battery Sucker
Reviews.Author: PewaukeeDad
Reviews.Content: Great pictures, easy to use and constantly eating batteries.  I've never seen anything like it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in lack of sharp focus
Reviews.Author: M. Stjohn
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera hoping that it would be even better than my Kodak EasyShare C875.  I was disappointed.  No matter how hard I try, pictures are always just a little bit blurry.  Photos from my C875 are crystal clear.  The settings on the older C875 also seem to be a bit more extensive than on the newer camera.  I cannot recommend this camera.  Get the C875 and you will be happy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent features for the price point
Reviews.Author: JStringe "Let's entertain me"
Reviews.Content: This is an easy to use fun digital camera that produces excellent photographs.  It is a great little camera.  I have found that most Kodak accessories are compatible, and uploading to your pictures folder is a snap.  The 2.5 inch LCD is too small if you are farsighted, and it is necessary for me to wear glasses to use the camera.

Reviews.Title: Low quality pictures
Reviews.Author: R. Leet
Reviews.Content: I have had Kodak Easy Share cameras for years.  This is the first time I am disappointed in one.  Out doors the pictures are of OK quality.  Pictures that require a flash are really bad.  They are grainy and not clear.I would not recomend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it!!!
Reviews.Author: Lambeaux
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Z1485 eats batteries.  We sent ours back twice to be repaired to no avail.  Of course Kodak will not refund any money you spent buying the camera via Amazon or any other on-line source.If you use a Mac computer, iPhoto will not recognize the video clips taken on a Z1485, so your stuck with a PC or going to Walgreens or other photo shop to get equipment that will read the data card from the camera.Very unhappy with the camera and will never buy Kodak again, period, dot; nasty letter follows.

Reviews.Title: I have this came and if you want to be happy  you muc=st by generic  extra  batteries , I bought 2 batts with a  charger for 17$
Reviews.Author: Debra L. Searcy "jayco"
Reviews.Content: When I bought this camera or  actually my wife gave it me to keep  me from wearing out the EOS cameras in my bag, and I was most pleased until the  battery ran out and I had  rechargeables that never  worked , so I bought the generic  version of kodaks  battery and  i got two with a charger  for  17 bucks off of that bay place and they will give me an averga of  400 shots per battery so  now im  thrilled , I wish it shot in Raw format  but  no chance of that I guess,  the  14 meg part is  misleading  you will get  fanatastic  shots without any efforrt , i mean really great shots you can practically fall over and  get a good shot, the  thing is  14 meg pocket camers  gives me  3 megs pics  sometimes  4-5  which i expecected at least 10 megs  so i could edit  or crop more  ,but  for  family  events this cam  does a lovely job and  does  super  video  with the option to  zoom while  still filming,  thats about it we gave way more than  this price  above  it was 300 bucks or so last  xmas. so this is a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: Lo mejor del producto es lo facil de usar
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Morales
Reviews.Content: facil de usar, muy comoda y fecil de llevar en cualquier parte, lo unico malo es que al grabar en HD la bateria no dura nada.

Reviews.Title: Great pics - Learning Experience on the HD video
Reviews.Author: Earbender "Mary"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on sale this Christmas. It has very little documentation in the manual and only provides you with basic info that you will figure out on your own. The extensive manual is online but that is really a specs guide, not a How to or Best Practices by any means. This is a very easy camera, takes great shots and has corrected all of the issues I have had with taking pictures. Sunlight streaming in from the windows, backlit photos, dark rooms - all auto fixed - no problem. Just know that included in the price you will need to purchase a battery, docking station (optional but it will charge the battery and make life easy on the upload of pics), install software (easyshare and Quicktime as video is .mov only), a camera bag, hd docking station if you want and a sdhc memory card if you don't already have one. But most cameras will require the same things.Two issues I had with this camera were the video - this was my first experience with HD video so anyone like me that is new to this I hope this helps. I didn't realize that my laptop which works great is officially out of date on the RAM. I took the video in HD mode but then on playback the audio was consistent but the picture froze up and was choppy, a little grainy as well. I bought a new memory card since the one I used was standard SD and old, I contacted Support (took forever to figure it out and couldn't offer me a workaround). Support told me to download the latest software which I had, then told me my video card couldn't support it. Close, I don't have enough RAM in my laptop or in my new netbook or in my husband's laptop. Apparently all my computers are now out of date for this purpose. This was so frustrating. The support person told me to change the video quality and lower it. So I changed it to 640/480 same issue. I changed it to the lowest setting and that works. I used my work computer to verify the other two settings did work. All 3 video settings are very good quality. The only grainy pic was the HD but I believe that is my computer as the screen in quicktime was larger in that mode and it couldn't support it. Much better than my old Sony Cybershot 7.2mp or even my regular video camera.The other issue I had was installing their software on my laptop. I went through support and over and over again uninstalling and reinstalling. I still have not been able to install on one of my computers. I literally spent the last 2 days working on this camera and trying to figure out the software and the video. I was very close to returning but impressed with the still shots and easy of use that I was determined to make sure this was a bad camera before returning. Besides for the price I absolutely could not find another one comparable.It would be nice to have more of an optical zoom on it since this is 5x and some of the others are 10x but for the price again I'm fine with it. It has met my needs for zooming so far too so it is definitely a keeper.My next step is to figure out how to burn a dvd, upload video to someplace I can watch it or maybe upgrade my ram. I'd like to find a work around though because my laptop still meets my needs with this exception but not sure I want to spend money on RAM and I'd like to take advantage of the HD quality.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: lji
Reviews.Content: I already have one, I purchased this one for my son as a gift!  Would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Refurbished product.
Reviews.Author: Julia A. Gonsalves Carmody
Reviews.Content: This camera was a total disappointment to me.  I have sent it back twice for either repair or replacement.  I am sending this one back for a refund.I have never had this much trouble with a Kodak product before and I am very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Died after 2 weeks
Reviews.Author: Flot
Reviews.Content: I should have known better after reading the mixed reviews, but bought this camera and it died after 2 weeks.  Unfortunately there aren't many kodak models left that work with the dock I already own, or the $20 battery I bought for this one.  Kodak support sounded like a callcenter you know where, no opportunities for advance replacement of an obviously defective item.  Thanks a lot kodak.

Reviews.Title: Terrible indoor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my 8 mp Kodak Easyshare C875 camera that just decided to stop working. Kodak told me that camera would cost as much to repair as buying a new one, so I figured I'd go ahead and upgrade. BIG MISTAKE. I am promptly returning this camera and paying to have Kodak repair my old one.This camera takes terrible indoor pictures. I used the auto setting in low lighting, and because it automatically applies the Perfect Touch technology on this setting, it over-corrected the lighting and left pictures grainy. Even the high ISO setting performed poorly in low-lighting, leaving a lot of noise in the pictures. Manual settings with flash could not produce enough lighting to get anything other than too-dark pictures. I also took indoor pictures in optimal lighting and all the dark colors in the picture had tons of noise. Skin tones look washed out indoor as well.I tested out the camera outdoors as well, taking pictures of fall foliage. Colors were muted, and image never came out crisp. I blame this on the lens - it is sub-par, whereas my old Easyshare has a Schneider-Kreuznach glass lens which produced extremely crisp pictures.I would advise against buying this camera, even if you only casually take pictures. Indoor quality is extremely poor, and outdoor quality is below average. Don't let the 14 megapixels draw you in. It is not a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Does it all
Reviews.Author: Rosharn "Rosharn Walker"
Reviews.Content: I will asmit, my daughters camera she bought over seas takes the most amaizing general pictures. But for those of us that dont have her talent and desire to develope it, here is the answer. This camera does everything I cant do. I love it!

Reviews.Title: Takes Horrible Pictures!
Reviews.Author: Vicki Lightner "Vicki"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use as a simple every day camera to keep in my purse.  This Kodak takes the very worst pictures, especially when using the zoom lense.  None of my "zoom" pictures have any clarity whatsoever, they're fuzzy and blurred. I thought it was just me, so I've loaned the camera to other people and they've had the same problems.I have four grandsons under the age of three, and unless they're sitting still (hardly ever happens) my pictures of them are just a colored blur.  I wish I'd never bought this camera.  Kodak used to be a name you could trust for quality film and cameras, but not this model.

Reviews.Title: Major disappointment
Reviews.Author: P. Bowman
Reviews.Content: Comes with lithium battery pack (pre charged) and NO CHARGER (!!!). My older Kodak DX came with a charger. For almost $200, I'm feeling disappointed and shortchanged. Oh, and it is incompatible with all but the newest Easyshare Printer Docks (if you have an Easyshare dock older than 1yr. you are S.O.L.). They should rename it Not-So-Easyshare. In summary: It's bad enough that the Easyshare is fast made obsolete; worse yet is including a rechargable battery with no charger (even cell phones have provisions for recharging batteries).

Reviews.Title: battery life is horrible
Reviews.Author: Mollie M. Johnson "mj0616"
Reviews.Content: I have used $70 worth of batteries in four months. I called Kodak and told them that the camera keeps eating batteries, it shuts off by itself all of the time, and it will take a picture and then the picture will disappear. I sent the camera in to have it fixed and they sent it back to me without fixing it. The "supervisor" that I spoke to told me to just replace the battery. Not any help at all. In the warranty it shows that they will replace the camera, fix the camera, or give you your money back and they have refused to do any of the above. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!

Reviews.Title: Good pictures, but poor quality camera
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: We purchased the first camera in August,2009.  When we first received it, we tested it out for about a week.  We took all sorts of pictures that turned out beautiful.  We were going to Florida on 9/16/2009, and wanted a nice camera to take with us.  Five days prior to leaving, we started using the camera again.  After about 10 min. of use, the camera would flash a bright light across the screen, then shut off.  We turned it back on, and again, we got the bright light and it shut off.  We changed the batteries, thinking this may be the issue, but nothing changed.  We called the shopping channel we purchased it from, and we were still able to return the camera.  However, the replacement would not be here in time to take with us on our trip.  We went to Amazon.com  and ordered it through the Prime option, and received the camera the day before we left.  The second camera had a whole different set of problems.  This camera took a long time to shut off (16-33 seconds after we turned it off).  We had to keep opening the battery compartment to shut the camera off quicker.  Sometimes, it wouldn't let us review the photos that we had taken, and we were lucky if we had about a half-hour of battery life for each set of batteries we put in the camera.  This one went back as well.

Reviews.Title: GRAINY indoor pictures, never a crisp photo, always miss the shot of my baby that I wanted
Reviews.Author: Lisa Bailey "Just a mom trying to take a pict...
Reviews.Content: The pictures that I uploaded are pictures 41 - 45 if you want to see.My previous camera was a Kodak Easyshare Z71 (or Z73?).  If they had sent me the same camera I would have been perfectly happy.  However, I am sending the Z1485 back for a refund.  I used the SD Kodak memory card that I used with my last camera.* Grainy photos, especially indoors.  Really, this camera ruined what could have been perfectly adorable pictures of my baby.  I will post in the images section.  The moment is gone and because of Kodak, I'll never get that picture.* Shutter speed not fast enough.  By the time the picture took, the baby is looking away.  Even with the action setting.* Image stabilization is sensitive and poor.  I lived in fear that I was not holding the camera still enough.  I tried so hard to hold the camera still and slowly push the shutter button but my picture would never come out crisp.* Orange indoor shots on automatic setting.* Gray indoor shots without flash.* Indoor colors in general were poor.  I could barely tell if it was navy blue or brown I was looking at.* Flash was not strong enough.  I took a picture of baby in foreground and grandma in background has no benefit from the flash.* Never got the crisp photo I was looking for.In the past I was a big fan of Kodak EasyShare and even bought my own Z71 camera after purchasing one for a friend and loving hers.  My husband loved my Z71 and never used his different brand digital camera and always opted for my Z71.Kodak has shattered my loyalty with the Z1485.

Reviews.Title: Not are good as it should be
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Flo"
Reviews.Content: I have and use Kodak camera's and was really looking forward to a nice compact camera as a take along in my purse. Well it is small and compact and does fit my purse unfortunately it doesn't do as good a job as my other Kodak cameras. There is something related to the focusing that is off. Even in the auto focus mode the camera struggles to get a clear focus on a item that is right in front of it. The telephoto lens works well and the video capture is the best feature and works well. I like that the video is in HD and it does capture audio well. I would have kept this one if the focus issue wasn't present but am returning it and replacing it with a Panasonic Lumix DMC-TZ5 9 mega pixel with a 10x optical lens.  Hope I like that one.

Reviews.Title: GOOD FOR THE MONEY
Reviews.Author: Bob L. Williamson
Reviews.Content: GLAD IT WAS CHEAP SINCE IT WAS A CHRISTMAS GIFT FOR MY GRANDSON AND HE LOST IT IN THREE DAYS.

Reviews.Title: Very bad battery life
Reviews.Author: C. Nilsen
Reviews.Content: The camera would only take 10-30 pictures on a fresh set of NiMH batteries before shutting down.  Tried a variety of fully charged batteries, but the result was the same.  I returned the camera.

Reviews.Title: Kodak 14mp Didgital Camera
Reviews.Author: Theodore August "Ted"
Reviews.Content: I had ordered this item after careful thought. My reasoning for having placed my order, was because of the outstanding reputation Kodak has.Placed my order with amazon and item was shipped by All Pro Sports Cards out of Middletown, Ohio. Item arrived in a timely manner. Packaging seemed to be rather good. Opened said package and only found the camera itself with nothing else included. I was under the impression, this was a rebuilt item and it included everything stated within the advertisement. ONLY item included, was a pair of AA batteries. Lesson learned, don't place a order for a used/rebuilt item! Just in case your wondering? This lesson cost me 144 bucks.Upon inspection, found this camera to have been heavily used. (Scratches and heavy wear marks.) My first impression, was that my order came from a pawn shop. Contacted seller and he had stated this was a used item. And that, he included a sim card. Sorry to say, this camera had no sim card installed nor was one, located within said packaging. I had the impression he didn't believe me, but he did say, he'd mail one out at the soonest. Asked if his place of business was a pawn shop and he stated, no that it wasn't and it was a Sports Card business. Google maps, (Street view.) said otherwise. No matter what you call a rose, it still smells the same.The item itself, works as expected. Did find that it will eat a set of new batteries, in just a matter of a few short minutes. Install rechargeable batteries, and they will only last but a few short seconds. I highly do recommend that you use nothing but Lithium or like batteries to power this unit.The camera is very easy to use and online help was outstanding. This is a great little camera to keep with you, for them unexpected moments. Overall quality of images, was good. What little video I was able to take, was good and the sound quality, was also good. To expect better, then you must be willing to spend $500 or more.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD FOR PRICE BETTER THAN SOME THAT COST 3 TIMES AS MUCH
Reviews.Author: C. Barry
Reviews.Content: THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST I HAVE USED FOR THE PRICE, IT IS VERY EASY TO USE AND TAKES SOME OF THE BEST PICTURES I HAVE SEEN. WOULD COMPARE TO SOME COSTING 3 TIMES MORE.

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera I Have Ever Owned!
Reviews.Author: A. Johnson
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that this is at least my 6th digital camera, so I have been using them since the early days... My last camera was a Kodak 1285 which I returned immediately due mainly to slow/poor focusing. I decided to give this one a chance, because I read a lot of reviews saying how all the problems they had with the 1285 were fixed on this camera. Not true! Unfortunately, I can't return it, as I bought it from an Amazon 3rd party.Where to begin,1. First of all the battery life is HORRIBLE! A pair of AA batteries lasts, without exaggeration, about 12 pictures (without a flash)! Or even less with a flash. Every time I use it I have to bring 10 AAs with me. I have tried everything from the cheapest to the most expensive batteries, without much difference in # of photos. The supplied Lithium-Ion battery lasted about 20 pictures! At this point, I don't want to invest more money in this camera by buying a charger/rechargeables.2. Any motion pictures under anything but perfect lighting are blurred, no matter whether it is in auto or scene modes.3. Very slow save time and very slow response time (shutter lag) I have missed so many shots it's ridiculous.4. Shuts off for no reason at all, even with new batteries. This is not a auto-shut-off feature, as it will shut off with the lens still extended.5. Good pictures when it actually worksI will never buy another Kodak camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent still camera, reliable...
Reviews.Author: Paul M. Ploeger "Verbose Engineer"
Reviews.Content: Hello.  I purchased a fine Kodak camera based on experience.  Not having read more information than included here "HD video features - Capture HD quality video. Capture more video while using less memory with MPEG-4".  What that translates into is (our product records in Apples ".mov" format-indeed a fine video compression method).  This means that I purchased, as stated, an excellent still camera.  The videos are very good, but:  They can be uploaded to the computer, transfered on disk...  as anything but convert them into a useable format for editing or recording on coventional video devices (MPEG-4). This is the product as delivered; true the basic Quicktime program is free, but that does no more than stated.  To produce usefull videos, one must activate Quicktime Pro (the current outlay being just under US$30 - which must then be done again when Apples regular upgrades are downloaded and installed).  Over the lifetime of the camera, which is extremely long -  Each basic battery for my camcorder costs a bit more, is rechargable, lasts 10 years in regular rotation - and the camcorder records MPEG4 on standard disks.  Ah, it's a bit bulky - but 2 hours of useable video in an easilly edited, converted and played format?  Why not.  Please - Apple, and those cameras using their format will claim that Quicktime is "the" industry standard.  Flat out, it's an excellent still camera.  Please expect compounded expenses over time if one does any more than record video or upload it to a video service that convert ".mov" files into a more common format for distribution.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Michelle Ing
Reviews.Content: The camera is good but one thing is that it is a different color than what was on the description.  i wanted a blue camera and that is what I ordered..  I received a black camera.  looking at the email it even states that it was supposed to be blue...is there anyway I can return it for blue

Reviews.Title: Not very happy
Reviews.Author: S. MCCASLIN "Absolute Nuke"
Reviews.Content: Saw and bought this camera on one of the TV shopping networks.  Bought two of them; one for me and one as a gift for Christmas.  The blown up pictures they showed looked vivid and sharp.  What they don't tell you is that this camera eats up batteries big time.  It takes two AA batteries and they last about 10 - 20 minutes (Alkaline), depending on how many pics you take and if you're zooming in and out.  Definitely not the camera I want to take on vacation. I'd be spending 20% of my time changing batteries.  And about the 14 Megapixels; if you're not going to blow up pictures any larger than 8" x 10", anything over 3 megs is a waste.  You can get many 5 meg cameras (and even higher) for around the same price and you can be sure the batteries will last 10 or more times longer than this camera.  I haven't downloaded any pictures on the computer yet, but they do look really sharp and the colors are vivid on the camera.  It probably does take very good pictures, but having to change batteries all the time is costly and very frustrating when you're outside taking pictures of nature or sports, etc.  And again if you're not going to blow up your pictures, you are wasting your money on a 14 meg camera when a 5-8 meg camera will do the trick.  The more the megs, the shorter the battery life, rule of thumb.  I wish I would have done my homework and read the reviews before I bought, because I never would have bought this camera had I done so.One more thing.  I tried to view the pictures I took on our HDTV with the USB cable that comes with the camera and the TV read "No Signal."  If you read the reviews, many people are saying the USB cord looks flimsy and easily damaged.  I haven't tried another cable yet, but I'd like to see the pictures from this camera on HDTV as I'm sure they should be sharp and clear.  I REALLY want to like this camera, but...
